intro: Agrostis buchtarmensis, commonly known as the Bukhtarma grass, is a perennial grass species native to Central Asia. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as steppes and grasslands. The plant has slender,丛生 (clump-forming) growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a spike-like cluster of small, spikelet-bearing branches. Agrostis buchtarmensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions, making it resilient to drought and poor soil conditions.
